newsitem.title: UK: Granada edges up after top-end H1 profits.
newsitem.headline: Granada edges up after top-end H1 profits.

text.p: Shares in Granada Group Plc nudged higher in pre-market trade on Wednesday after the media-to-hotels group posted first half profits at the top end of most analyst expectations, dealers said.
The stock was up 1p at 903-1/2 by 0702 GMT, extending a rebound since it dropped to a six-month low of 849-1/2 on June 4.
"Profits are at the top end of expectations but the dividend looks at the low end, though that's probably understandable given their high debt levels," said one analyst.
"But I think the meeeting will be more important, people will be looking to see how they are progressing their disposals and at the underlying growth of the former Forte businesses."
However, the analyst noted a strong performance in Granada's hotels businesses, with yield for instance up 16 percent.
"Hotels look to be having a storming time, with yield and occupancy rates very good...it suggests they bought Forte at a good time."

Chairman Gerry Robinson said all four of Granada's divisions had performed strongly. "We will continue to grow these businesses organically and maximise the benefit of the tremendous assets that the company now has."
Chief executive Charles Allen added that the "first few weeks of the second half are showing an encouraging start to trading."
